						BROKEN SOCIETY





In the first of our series "Broken Society", we have a powerful film made by children in Hackney.


They talk about living on the estates there: their experience of gang culture, gun and knife crime. 


Earlier this year there were a series of murders of young black people in south London.


Tony Blair in April said that the spate of gun attacks was part of a "distinctive black culture" rather than about poverty and deprivation.   


Is he right? What's your experience of gangs and gun crime? Is it confined to one ethnic group? Let us know via our website.


Also, tell us what subjects you'd like to see us tackling as part of our "Broken Society" series.
